intro: Osteospermum trigonospermum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like blooms. The plant features a sturdy, upright stem with narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and yellow, with a distinctive central disk. Osteospermum trigonospermum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and resilience in various climates.
